beer.beer_description:
Symposium (noun): a drinking party or convivial discussion, especially as held in ancient Greece after a banquet

Our brewers got together for their own symposium, and Ollie came up with a banger, a beer brewed with real woodfire roasted chestnuts 

This delightfully roasty chestnut amber ale has a rich malty backbone, a subtle sweetness and a nutty finish. Perfect for those cold autumn evenings. May contain traces of deliciousness
You sent
Nice work

items.badge_description: Kiwis, rugby and sheep aren’t the only things New Zealand has to offer. There’s a ton of great beers in a variety of styles just waiting for you to explore! That's 205 different beers from a brewery in New Zealand. Try 5 more for Level 42.

items.badge_description: At a new place and don't want to choose a pint of something you may not like? Grab a few tasters! Enjoy some small pours and then decide which to upgrade to a full pour. That's 415 checkins with the serving style of Taster. Try 5 more for Level 84! Want to learn more about this badge? Check out our podcast

items.badge_description: Fresh from the tap is one of the best ways to enjoy a beer. Just try to use a glass and not drink directly from the tap, as tempting as it may be. That's 70 checkins with the serving style of Draft. Try 5 more for Level 15!

items.badge_description: Looking for more kick than a session beer, but want to be able to stay for a few rounds? You have to keep it in the middle. That's 415 beers with an ABV greater than 5% and less than 10%.  Try 5 more for Level 84!

Kiwis, rugby and sheep aren’t the only things New Zealand has to offer. There’s a ton of great beers in a variety of styles just waiting for you to explore! That's 405 different beers from a brewery in New Zealand.  Try 5 more for Level 82!

What's better than enjoying a beer outside with food, music, games all in an enjoyable atmosphere? We couldn't think of anything. That's a beer at 5 different venues with the category of Beer Garden. Visit 5 more for Level 2!
